image.altText: Kym Valentine stands near venetian blinds, with some light passing onto her face

props.synopsis: Advocates are concerned changes to alcohol delivery laws, which were a recommendation of South Australia's Royal Commission into Family, Sexual and Domestic Violence, are taking too long.

title.children: 'Be brave': DV prevention advocate urges action on delayed alcohol laws

image.altText: A woman holding a baby at the beach at sunset

props.synopsis: Meg Longstaff hoped to continue a family tradition of beach holidays this summer, but a council decision on fire safety enforcement means she and other unit owners may be forced to make other plans.

title.children: Holiday cabin owners kicked out after new council safety ruling

image.altText: The sport of foiling increasing in popularity

props.synopsis: Emerging battery technologies has given rise to electric surfboards and motorised foil boards, but as the SA government considers exclusion zones to keep them away from traditional water users, proponents say better education is needed.

title.children: Calls for regulation as motorised hydrofoils create a splash

image.altText: A radio host in braces and a tie.

props.synopsis: Long-running Adelaide commercial radio host Leon Byner has died at the age of 77 after a battle with acute leukaemia.

title.children: Adelaide commercial radio host Leon Byner dies aged 77

image.altText: Flames and smoke from the Cudlee Creek fire in the Adelaide Hills.

props.synopsis: Victims of the devastating 2019 Cudlee Creek bushfire, which caused more than $200 million in damage, are seeking compensation from SA Power Networks, alleging the electricity distributor was negligent in the lead-up to the blaze.

title.children: Class action trial over catastrophic Cudlee Creek bushfire begins in SA

image.altText: Old, torn up letter with writing in lead sitting on top of a new sheet of white paper

props.synopsis: The grandchildren of a World War I soldier who sent a message in a bottle from a transport ship say it is like a "clue in a treasure map".

title.children: The letter home that took more than a century to arrive

image.altText: A green and yellow ambulance driving on a road

props.synopsis: Changes to road rules allowing e-scooters to be used on some public roads in South Australia are the subject of renewed debate, following the death of a man using one of the devices.

title.children: E-scooter rider's crash death reopens road rule debate in SA

image.altText: A man sits in an office and reads a report.

props.synopsis: Australia's next high commissioner to the United Kingdom's time in politics was defined by consultative leadership, pizza politics and a gatecrashed press conference.

title.children: Who is Australia's new top diplomat in the UK?

image.altText: A person on top of a wind turbine.

props.synopsis: It was a moment of euphoria when the world came together to sign a pact on climate action. Ten years on from the 2015 Paris Agreement we managed to shift the needle. But the problem is it's just not happening fast enough.

title.children: Five charts show what has changed since the world agreed to fight climate change

image.altText: Shane Wanganeen is wearing a dark jacket and glasses as he walks along a footpath.

props.synopsis: A man whose young son died after his pneumonia was left untreated is refused bail ahead of his sentencing for criminal neglect, with a judge noting his history of being "persistently non-compliant" while on supervised bail. WARNING: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised this article contains the name of a person who has died.

title.children: Father of seven-year-old neglect victim denied bail

image.altText: The skyline of Adelaide along the River Torrens

props.synopsis: As the UN's annual climate change conference kicks off in Brazil, authorities in Adelaide are still in the dark about whether Australia's fifth-biggest city will be hosting next year's event.

title.children: Adelaide preparing for COP31 on 'incredibly tight timeframe'

image.altText: Emergency department signage at the Lyell McEwin Hospital.

props.synopsis: About 10 per cent of mental health patients in South Australian hospital emergency departments are being kept waiting "more than 35 hours" for a bed, the AMA says.

title.children: Emergency department waits of 35 hours for some SA mental health patients, AMA warns

image.altText: A brown wooden lectern with a 'SAVE HEALTHCARE" sign on the steps of the US Congress building

props.synopsis: A US Senate vote to approve funding legislation looks set to break a political stalemate that has sidelined federal workers, delayed food aid and significantly disrupted domestic air travel.

title.children: The US government shutdown is one step closer to ending. Here is what happens next

image.altText: Kangaroo road sign

props.synopsis: Drivers on regional roads are being warned of an increase in kangaroo activity on South Australian roads, with large mobs of roos seen lining roads at dawn and dusk, creating growing safety concerns for road users.

title.children: 'Dodging them everywhere': Warning to SA drivers over kangaroo risk increase

image.altText: Security officials inspect the scene of a car explosion near the historic Red Fort.

props.synopsis: Investigators are piecing together what happened after an explosion in a densely populated area of India's capital killed at least eight people.

title.children: What we know about the deadly car explosion near Delhi's Red Fort

image.altText: Kirsty Coventry claps

props.synopsis: The International Olympic Committee heard from experts from the Protection of the Female Category working group last week, with a decision set to be made on rules around transgender athletes competing at the Olympics.

title.children: No decision yet on transgender athletes' Games eligibility, IOC says

image.altText: A man in a suit standing in front of a large BBC Scotland building.

props.synopsis: It is not US President Donald Trump who represents the biggest political threat to the BBC, but a leaked 8,000-word letter of complaint to the broadcaster's board motivated by "despair at inaction".

title.children: Why the BBC's issues go deeper than its 'doctoring' of Trump video

image.altText: The Sydney Opera House lit up with poppies as a bugler plays on Remembrance Day, 2025.

props.synopsis: People across Australia have gathered to commemorate Remembrance Day and honour those who have died while serving in conflicts and peace-keeping operations.

title.children: Australians mark 107th Remembrance Day with services honouring the fallen

image.altText: A man in a suit looks on while sitting in a chair.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for the US president warn Britain's national broadcaster they are preparing to sue it over "fabricated" statements that aired in its Panorama program last year.

title.children: Trump threatens to sue 'corrupt' BBC for $1.5b over 'salacious' documentary

image.altText: A group of the wiggles

props.synopsis: The Wiggles will produce an episode of their parenting podcast, highlighting the product's recall and safety issues relating to button batteries.

title.children: The Wiggles 'likely breached' consumer law with sale of headbands: ACCC

image.altText: Boxes are stacked to the roof in the boot of a car, blocking the driver's view out the rear.

props.synopsis: Tech giant Amazon claims to offer convenience to both its customers and its contractors. This is what the drivers behind your packages want you to know.

title.children: Amazon is supposed to deliver convenience. Its drivers say they walk 'on eggshells'

image.altText: David Szalay sits in a jumper, brow furrowed, holding a copy of his book.

props.synopsis: Hungarian British author David Szalay bests past winner Kiran Desai and former shortlistee Andrew Miller to win the prestigious Booker Prize for his sixth book, the "extraordinary, singular" Flesh.

title.children: 'Never read anything like it': David Szalay's Flesh wins $100k Booker Prize

image.altText: A woman sits at a desk in front of her computer. She looks into the camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Some of Australia's leading early childhood education professors join forces to release a six-point action plan to help fix the country's "broken" childcare system.

title.children: Professors urge governments to overhaul 'broken' childcare system

image.altText: A b-double truck and a car covered with an orange tarp.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police say two vehicles collided shortly after 9:30am at the intersection of Mount William Road and Eurambeen-Streatham Road, about 45 minutes west of Ballarat.

title.children: One adult, two children dead in crash near Ballarat

image.altText: CBA image

props.synopsis: Australian stocks have slipped despite a tech rebound on Wall Street, while Australia's biggest bank, Commonwealth Bank, has reported a marginal rise in first-quarter profit. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: Commonwealth Bank posts $2.6b quarterly profit, ASX slips

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Can the surge in positivity in the Westpac-Melbourne Institute consumer sentiment survey be trusted?
Warren Buffett's final message to shareholders, at age 95
Jump in consumer sentiment suggests solid pre-Christmas spending could be on the way

image.altText: a 100 RMB and a 100 USD currency are displayed on a table with the Chinese and American flags in the background

props.synopsis: Two leading experts on the world's biggest economies warn both countries face serious challenges, and not just over trade with each other.

title.children: US risks AI debt bubble as China faces its 'arithmetic problem'

image.altText: A mix of yellow and red colours bursting with pockets of blue representing the Milky Way

props.synopsis: The Milky Way appears as a dusty band of stars, but by observing its radio frequencies a different view can be seen, revealing parts of the galaxy hidden from sight.

title.children: New 'radio map' of Milky Way reveals where stars are born and die

image.altText: An aerial shot of mountain ranges in Guinea with Rio Tinto's Simandou iron ore project being established.

props.synopsis: For decades, China has resented being held hostage over the iron ore price by its own insatiable demand and a handful of Australian producers.

title.children: China succeeds in a decades-long quest to crimp Australian power

image.altText: Man lying in hospital with eyes closed and medical tubes attached to his body

props.synopsis: Ian Parker waited more than three months for urgent heart surgery that should have been done within 30 days. He was inspired to share his story after an ABC investigation.

title.children: Cardiac patients fear surgery delays will put lives at risk

image.altText: Prince William and Princess Catherine attend a ceremony. Catherine is wearing a large red hat.

props.synopsis: Prince William has opened up about he and Catherine's "balancing act" in talking to their children about the family's recent health challenges, including the princess and King Charles's cancer diagnoses.

title.children: How William and Catherine told their children about princess's cancer

image.altText: A blurry photo of a woman crouched beside a campfire.

props.synopsis: The woman lit a prohibited fire on the protected sand island and used a drone in a restricted area.

title.children: Rangers fine influencer for lighting illegal fire on World Heritage island

image.altText: A sign that says Dandenong Creek Trail

props.synopsis: A school in Melbourne's south-east says it is "deeply saddened" following the drowning death of one of its students in Dandenong Creek on Monday.

title.children: Tributes for woman and child who drowned in Melbourne creek

image.altText: A woman holding a child on a road, wading through floodwater

props.synopsis: The aftermath of a 1,800-kilometre-wide super typhoon has left more than a million people displaced from their homes in the Philippines.

title.children: Typhoon Fung-wong leaves at least eight dead, displaces 1.4 million
